Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナ
Entry.EnglishText: Selena

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場長
Entry.EnglishText: Manager

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場
Entry.EnglishText: Iron Factory

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場
Entry.EnglishText: Iron Factory

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>、どこに行ってたの？
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>, where did you go?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ、ちょっと……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, I was just...

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、急に暑くなってきたな。 誰か、機械を動かしたのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, it's getting hot in here all of a sudden. Did someone start the machines?

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、<Claire>……
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>, don't tell me you...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 騒ぎを起こせば、 ガジュマの皆さんも 出てくると思ったのですが……
Entry.EnglishText: I wanted to cause a commotion so that the Gajuma would come out of that room...

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんて事を……！ た、大変だ！
Entry.EnglishText: W-What were you thinking! We're in danger!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここの機械は一度おかしくなると 再調整が難しいんだ……！
Entry.EnglishText: It's difficult to readjust the machines when something goes wrong with them!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、暑くて目が回ってきた…… だ、誰か…… 早く機械を止めてくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: Aah, it's so hot in here that I'm starting to feel faint... S-Someone... Someone needs to turn them off...

Entry.JapaneseText: はぁ……はぁ……工場長…… みんな、暑さで動けないわ…… わ、私も……ダメ……
Entry.EnglishText: Haa... Haa... Boss... Nobody can move...in this heat... M-Myself...included...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……はぁ……はぁ…… お願い……早く出てきて……
Entry.EnglishText: Haa... Haa... Please, come out, quickly...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……おまえたち…… なんて事をするんだ……！
Entry.EnglishText: You people... Just what have you done?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺たちを蒸し焼きに するつもりか!!
Entry.EnglishText: Do you intend to cook us alive in there?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ち、違う……そこの娘が…… 勝手に機械を……
Entry.EnglishText: N-No... This girl... Went and tampered with the machines...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうすれば止められる？
Entry.EnglishText: ...How can we turn them off?

Entry.JapaneseText: このままでは、 俺たちの仲間まで…… 暑さで参っちまう……
Entry.EnglishText: At this rate, my comrades will all succumb to the heat...

Entry.JapaneseText: 機械の使い方は、俺が教える…… だから、手伝ってくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'll teach you how to use the machines... So please, help...

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、ああ……仕方ない…… 行くぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: A-All right... I don't have much choice... Let's go!

Entry.JapaneseText: 助かった……ありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: We're saved...! Thank you!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……別に、ヒューマのために やったわけじゃない……
Entry.EnglishText: I didn't exactly do it to save you Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうして、どうして そんな事を言うのです？
Entry.EnglishText: Why...? What has you saying such a thing?

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちは、 何もわかっていないのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Have you learned nothing from this?

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、あんたのせいで、 こんな目にあったっていうのに、 何を偉そうに言ってるんだ!?
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, it's your fault this happened in the first place! You think you have the right to lecture us?!

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、そうだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, he's right...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマたちは部屋から出て来たが、 一歩間違えば、おおごとだった！ 謝ったらどうかね！
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma did leave the room, but if something had gone wrong, then we would have had a major incident on our hands! You should be apologizing!

Entry.JapaneseText: その事についてはお詫びします。 申し訳ありませんでした。
Entry.EnglishText: For that, I do apologize wholeheartedly. Please forgive my recklessness.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ですが、考えてください。
Entry.EnglishText: ...But please, consider this.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちは、 今、ふたつの力を合わせて、 問題を乗り越えたではありませんか。
Entry.EnglishText: Is it not true that you were able to combine both of your strengths to overcome this problem?

Entry.JapaneseText: なのに、ささいな事ですれ違い、 協力関係をそこなうのは 不幸な事ではありませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: And yet you continue to bicker over trivial matters, thus sabotaging any potential for cooperation. Is that not lamentable?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……工場の問題も 力を合わせて話し合っていけば、 乗り越えられるはずです。
Entry.EnglishText: I am certain that if you're able to work together and have an open discussion about your grievances with the factory, then you should be able to overcome them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 皆さん…… 皆さんは誤解し合っています！
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone, this is all just a misunderstanding!

Entry.JapaneseText: 対立の原因が、誤解だなんて 悲しくありませんか!?
Entry.EnglishText: The source of this conflict is just a misconception! Does that not sadden you!?

Entry.JapaneseText: きちんと話し合えば、 誤解も解けます！ ですから出てきてください！
Entry.EnglishText: If you talk things out, I'm sure this can all be resolved! So please, come on out!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、おまえは!? ガジュマか？ それともヒューマか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, just what are you?! Are you a Gajuma, or a Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: わたくしは……ガジュマ…… いえ……ヒューマです…… でも、ガジュマでもあります。
Entry.EnglishText: I am...a Gajuma... No, I am a Huma, but I'm a Gajuma as well!

Entry.JapaneseText: わけのわからん事を!! ふざけるな！
Entry.EnglishText: What the hell kind of talk is that? Gimme a break!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あーあ、ガジュマなんて 来なけりゃ、楽しく働けたのに！ まったく迷惑なヤツらだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Ugh. If those Gajuma hadn't come here, we'd be able to do our work in peace! They cause nothing but trouble!

Entry.JapaneseText: どこの街でもヒューマは 態度だけは大きいな。
Entry.EnglishText: Looks like Huma are arrogant no matter where you go.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマだけじゃ 何にもできねえくせして！
Entry.EnglishText: Even though they'd never get anything done by themselves!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだとっ!! おまえたちなんか、一生、 そこに閉じこもってろ!!
Entry.EnglishText: What'd you just say to me? You guys should keep yourselves locked in there for the rest of your lives!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうしてこうなってしまうの？ 話し合いさえできないなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: How did things get this way? They can't even hold a civil conversation...

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさん、 なんとかしてこの扉を開ける 方法はないのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Selena, is there really no way for us to get this door open?

Entry.JapaneseText: 内側から閉められてるから、 自分から出てこない限りは……
Entry.EnglishText: It's locked from the inside, so it'll stay shut, as long as they don't want to come out...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>この原版を持っていきますか？ 持っていく やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Take the plate with you? Take it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を手に入れました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You took the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>ここにあった原版を戻しますか？ 戻す やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Put back the plate? Return it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を戻しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You put back the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版は四つまでしか 持つ事ができません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You can only carry up to four plates.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>ここにあった原版を戻しますか？ 戻す やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Put back the plate? Return it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を戻しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You put back the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『製鉄用の道具』 製鉄用の道具につき 持ち出し禁止。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Tools for Working Steel - Tools used for steelworking are prohibited from being taken outside the workplace.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『製鉄用の原版』 細かい模様が刻まれた 鉄を作るための型。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Steel Plate - A mold for making steel with fine patterns engraved on it.

Entry.JapaneseText: この工場に恨みを持ったヤツの怨念が 溶鉱炉に出るようになったんだって、 昨日の夜に仲間から聞いたよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard from a buddy of mine last night that the blast furnace now contains the ghost of someone who has a grudge against this factory...

Entry.JapaneseText: 昨日の夜に仲間から聞いたよ…… この工場に恨みを持ったヤツの怨念が 溶鉱炉のところに出るんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: I heard from a buddy of mine last night that the blast furnace now contains the ghost of someone who has a grudge against this factory.

Entry.JapaneseText: あそこは、ウチの工場で 一番危険な場所だからな。 何があってもおかしくないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's the most dangerous place here in our factory. I wouldn't be surprised if something happened there.

Entry.JapaneseText: 恨みを持ったヤツなんて いないと思いたいけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd rather believe that there isn't anyone holding a grudge...

Entry.JapaneseText: あえて言うなら…… <Tytree>に恨みを持ってる ヤツならいるかもな？
Entry.EnglishText: But I think there might be someone who holds a grudge against <Tytree>...

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさんと仲良くしようとすると、 おまえがジャマばっかりするだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Aren't you always getting in people's way when they try to get close to Selena?

Entry.JapaneseText: オレはどれだけ、哀しい男たちの ヤケ酒に付き合った事か……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard many a guy complain about that while drowning their sorrows...

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、そんなの知るか…… ダメ男が姉貴に近づくから いけないんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: H-How would you know that... I just don't want any bad men getting close to my sister!

Entry.JapaneseText: はあ……セレーナさんも かわいそうだな……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah... poor Selena...

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさんと仲良くしようと すると、ティトレイが難くせつけて 近寄らせないんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you try to get friendly with Selena, then <Tytree> will start nitpicking your character and won't let you anywhere near his sister.

Entry.JapaneseText: あいつのせいで、セレーナさんも なかなか恋人がね……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of that, Selena hasn't been able to get a boyfriend...

Entry.JapaneseText: 恨みを持ったヤツなんて いないと思いたいけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd rather believe that there isn't anyone holding a grudge...

Entry.JapaneseText: あえて言うなら…… <Tytree>に恨みを持ってる ヤツならいるかもな？
Entry.EnglishText: But I think there might be someone who holds a grudge against <Tytree>...

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさんと仲良くしようとすると、 おまえがジャマばっかりするだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Aren't you always getting in people's way when they try to get close to Selena?

Entry.JapaneseText: オレはどれだけ、哀しい男たちの ヤケ酒に付き合った事か……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard many a guy complain about that while drowning their sorrows...

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、そんなの知るか…… ダメ男が姉貴に近づくから いけないんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: H-How would you know that... I just don't want any bad men getting close to my sister!

Entry.JapaneseText: はあ……セレーナさんも かわいそうだな……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah... poor Selena...

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさんと仲良くしようと すると、ティトレイが難くせつけて 近寄らせないんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you try to get friendly with Selena, then <Tytree> will start nitpicking your character and won't let you anywhere near his sister.

Entry.JapaneseText: あいつのせいで、セレーナさんも なかなか恋人がね……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of that, Selena hasn't been able to get a boyfriend...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだ！ 思い出したよ!! そういえば……おとといの朝に溶鉱炉へ 歩いて行くガップラを見たんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Oh! I just remembered! Two days ago, I saw Gappler over by the the blast furnace in the morning!

Entry.JapaneseText: 気になって後を追ってみたら もうガップラはいなくて…… きっとガップラは溶鉱炉に……
Entry.EnglishText: I thought it was weird, so I tried to follow after him, but he vanished... I'm sure the blast furnace had something to do with his dissapearance...

Entry.JapaneseText: おとといの朝早くにガップラが 溶鉱炉で突然いなくなったんだ。 きっとガップラは溶鉱炉に……
Entry.EnglishText: Two days ago, Gappler dissapeared by the blast furnace in the early hours of the morning. I'm sure the blast furnace had something to do with his disappearance...

Entry.JapaneseText: ずっと作業してなかったから 不安だったけど、 鉄の質が落ちてなくてほっとしたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I was relieved that the quality of the iron hasn't deteriorated, because I've been out of work for a while.

Entry.JapaneseText: この工場に恨みを持ったヤツの怨念が 溶鉱炉に出るようになったんだって、 昨日の夜に仲間から聞いたよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard from a buddy of mine last night that the blast furnace now contains the ghost of someone who has a grudge against this factory.

Entry.JapaneseText: ずっと作業してなかったから 不安だったけど、 鉄の質が落ちてなくてほっとしたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I was relieved that the quality of the iron hasn't deteriorated, because I've been out of work for a while.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺たちがせっかく親切にしても、 あいつらはお礼のひと言すらない。
Entry.EnglishText: Even when we went out of our way to be kind to them, they never said a word of thanks.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマってのは、恩知らずで、 自分勝手な奴らなんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma are ungrateful! They only think about themselves.

Entry.JapaneseText: だからガジュマを雇うのは 反対だったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I was against hiring them in the first place.

Entry.JapaneseText: 彼らは、ヒューマに街を 追い出されて来たそうですね……
Entry.EnglishText: They were chased away from their previous home by Huma, were they not?

Entry.JapaneseText: そのせいで、なかなか心を 開けないのではないでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: That may have made it difficult for them to open their hearts to others.

Entry.JapaneseText: さあ、どうだろうな。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, I guess...

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺たちがせっかく親切にしても、 あいつらはお礼のひと言すらない。
Entry.EnglishText: Even when we went out of our way to be kind to them, they never said a word of thanks.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマってのは、恩知らずで、 自分勝手な奴らなんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma are ungrateful! They only think about themselves.

Entry.JapaneseText: だからガジュマを雇うのは 反対だったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I was against hiring them in the first place.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシには、一体、何が不満なのか わからんのだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I have no idea what exactly they're dissatisfied with.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマたちは、自分たちばかり つらくて大変な仕事をさせられて、 ワシらヒューマたちは楽をしている、 と言うんだが……
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma were saying that they had to do all the hard work while us Huma had it easy.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは、ヒューマとガジュマを 別々にして、それぞれに合った 仕事を分担してもらっていた だけなのに……
Entry.EnglishText: All I did was seperate Huma and Gajuma into work I thought was befitting of them...

Entry.JapaneseText: 立てこもってる人たちは、 他の街をヒューマに追われて ペトナジャンカに来たの……
Entry.EnglishText: The people who have barricaded themselves in had come to Petnadjanka after being exiled from other towns by Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、まだヒューマに対して 心を開いてないみたいで…… ギスギスした空気はあったの だけれど……
Entry.EnglishText: So it seems like they still can't open their hearts to Huma... Though, things have been tense around here...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>……!! あなたが、どうしてここに？
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>! What are you doing here?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええと…… ちょっと近くまで来て……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, well... I was in the area...

Entry.JapaneseText: それより、今、何が……？
Entry.EnglishText: Anyway, what is going on?

Entry.JapaneseText: 街に来たばかりの ガジュマの作業員たちが、 「待遇が悪い」って ここに閉じこもってしまったの。
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma who have just arrived in this city have locked themselves away in there, after claiming they were mistreated.

Entry.JapaneseText: 待遇が悪いだなんて とんでもない！
Entry.EnglishText: I haven't mistreated them in the slightest!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はガジュマに合った仕事を させていただけだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I only assigned them work that I thought was befitting of a Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 器用なヒューマと力のあるガジュマ、 うまく作業の分担ができて、 仕事の効率も上がっていたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are dexterous, whereas Gajuma are physically strong, so I thought I could make things more efficient by dividing the workload appropriately...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: 柵が閉まっている……
Entry.EnglishText: The grating is shut...

Entry.JapaneseText: 柵が閉まってるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄柵が閉まっているな。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まってますね。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているな。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているわ。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているわ……
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっている。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.
